professionalExperience.name: Software Developer
summaryPoints: Developed a batch PDF generation system using RabbitMQ, saving $18M annually in reinsurance costs.
Created a custom chart renderer in JavaFX for scalable and efficient coverage chart generation.
Designed and built a cross-platform claims application with Ionic, Angular, TypeScript, and SQLite, enabling field adjusters to work offline.
Implemented offline mapping layers in ArcGIS, reducing $700/device annually in licensing costs by replacing ArcGIS Pro dependencies.
Integrated Oracle GeoDatabase for real-time land data retrieval and streamlined large-scale policy handling using an RMA-compliant batch import/export system.
Boosted field productivity with offline map tiles, photo attachments, and note-taking features.
Enhanced user experience by designing modern, user-friendly interfaces for quoting and claims processing, using TypeScript, jQuery, JSP, and Spring.

professionalExperience.name: Software Engineer Intern
summaryPoints: Engineered a multithreaded Python pipeline using Polars to process and interpolate SCADA data from power stations across Spain, achieving a 45% performance improvement.
Developed efficient PostgreSQL and MongoDB queries for SCADA configurations, ensuring seamless data ingestion and schema validation.
Integrated an SNMP dashboard into proprietary OSI frameworks, reducing system check intervals from 5 minutes to 5 seconds.
Created a standalone SNMP configurator to automate network setup, SCADA point generation, and server configuration.
Designed a Java Swing installer with automated deployment, backend integration, and intuitive UI/UX.
Presented technical solutions to 30 project managers, showcasing clear communication and domain expertise.

professionalExperience.name: Student Software Developer
summaryPoints: Worked with Android developers and the iOS team to ensure feature parity on the MyState app.
Developed key features including library and bus capacity tracking and dynamic dashboard widgets, serving over 10K+ students and faculty.
Used and integrated RESTful APIs developed by other university developers to integrate features.
Identified and removed 80% of existing memory leaks in the application using LeakCanary.
Migrated to Kotlin, reducing total lines of code by 17%, improving maintainability and readability.
Used Firebase Crashlytics daily to identify and fix bugs, ensuring a 95% crash-free rate.
Integrated dark mode, enhancing user engagement and aligning with modern design trends.
